intro: Elatostema yangbiense, commonly known as the Yangbi Elatostema, is a rare flowering plant native to the Yunnan province of China. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle plants, and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces tiny greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
